title: Electric potential - ring charge and Delta V ratio

content.question: Points <math alttext="uppercase x" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, <math alttext="uppercase Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and <math alttext="uppercase Z" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> lie along the <math alttext="lowercase x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis at the locations shown in the figure. There is a uniformly charged ring of radius <math alttext="12 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math> and total charge <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math> in the <math alttext="lowercase y lowercase z" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi><mi>z</mi></math>-plane. What is the ratio of differences in electric potential <math alttext="the fraction with numerator delta V sub uppercase X uppercase Y, end sub, and denominator delta V sub uppercase X uppercase Z, end sub, end fraction, equals the fraction with numerator V sub uppercase X, end sub, minus V sub uppercase Y, end sub, and denominator V sub uppercase X, end sub, minus V sub uppercase Z, end sub, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>XY</mtext></msub></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>XZ</mtext></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>?

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
